channel.title: Portfoward
channel.description:
Portfoward i cant figure out how to port forward for my router i looked at every guide but there not the same router i looked at www.portforward.com and my router isn't there can someone please help me please i whould be really greatfull.
My skype is : masterdef11
uggg still no help.

ultimatepkvillage:

^^ utorrent is the worst software to use for hosting a rsps and it only works with some routers. You are better of portforwarding through your router

uTorrent is used for people who can’t PF manually because of their router.

item.title: Portfoward
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Alright you might as well portfoward through your router.

Go to cmd open it up type ipconfig and see what your default gateway is type it into your URL and type in your username and pass and portfoward from there

Can I ask what server you are using

Read full topic

item.title: Portfoward
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Ill just help you right now

  1. Download Utorrent at this site http://www.utorrent.com/

  2. Install it (go through the wizard)

  3. Open Bit Torrent Up

  4. Go To Options At the top and click “Prefrences”

  5. In Prefrences go to the connection tab.

  6. You are going to see a random port in the box like “3603” Change that to 43594

  7. In those little tick boxes tick these that are green: 1.Enable UPnP port mapping
    2. Enable NAT-PMP port mapping
    3. Add Windows Firewall Exception
    4. Randomize port each start

Now Press Apply and Ok And your server is now portfowarding

P.S. if you run your server and it says “server is already in use” Close Bittorrent or Utorrent and Run your server then just open Utorrent or Bittorrent up again

Hope this helps

Read full topic
